alert.note: Alert for Calvert; Charles; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:08AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern Maryland, including the following counties, in central Maryland, Prince Georges. In southern Maryland, Calvert and Charles. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 308 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated that very heavy rainfall has fallen across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Isolated instances of flooding have been observed in areas with low water crossings. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waldorf... Clinton... Fort Washington... Chesapeake Ranch Estates... La Plata... Chesapeake Beach... Prince Frederick... Popes Creek... Flag Harbor... Calvert Cliffs... Rosaryville... Marlton... Dunkirk... Lusby... Saint Charles... Saint Leonard... Wicomico... Accokeek... Bryans Road... Brandywine... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
